intro: Tetrastigma strumarum, commonly known as the climbing grapevine, is a woody vine native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Vitaceae family and is characterized by its vigorous climbing habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by black, edible berries. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded, moist environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
